item.title: Traffic sin on pavement, 29th January
item.description:
This is the 10th time I have reported this in the past 2 months. I have been assured by a person from the council that it would be removed 2 months ago. It's partially blocking the pavement and causing confusion for drivers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Terrace Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road works taken out the whole carriage way northbound with all temporary traffic lights out, 29th January
item.description:
This morning the temporary lights were all out on all directions and caused a severe road congestion, creating "mayhem" and high-risk conditions. Giving the seriousness of this issue and possible an accident where all the vehicles/Cyclist /pedestrians using the road without any traffic light is completely unacceptable and need proper supervision and regular checks when there is no body working in site or present.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Edgware Road, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Expanding damage to the road, 29th January
item.description:
This is on the line taken by not only local buses but also that which I would take on my bicycle. It makes it difficult to traverse when wet & when there is a lot of traffic about. If my front wheel was to inadvertently go into this hole then there would be the possibility of damage to either or both of the wheels & of falling off, possibly in front of a vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millbrook Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly repaired holes reappeared, 29th January
item.description:
These badly repaired holes have been reported numerous times & not only by me. As a cyclist they are a danger to me, especially when I have to negotiate these roads when buses are also trying to turn in & out of Millbrook Avenue. When will this road be repaired correctly instead of a shovel full of tarmac be dumped in & flattened with the heel of a boot, just for the holes to reappear within a short period of time?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Millbrook Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bags dumped on street, 29th January
item.description:
Black bags dumped by our house. Please investigate who has done this by opening bags? Please remove quickly as if food included it could attract vermin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathfield Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden waste bin overflowing with rubbish onto the pavement, 29th January
item.description:
This bin doesn't seem to belong to anyone and is obstructing the pavement and collecting rubbish that is now spilling onto the pavement. It has been there several weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Valmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
